website_summaries.verdict: Simple trigger-style design at a mid-range price.
pros: Pistol grip design makes it simple to point at the object you want to measure
Just pull the trigger and the speed reading comes up on the large LCD display quickly
Recommended for ball sports and vehicles
cons: At 19 ounces, it's not as small and lightweight as others

customer_reviews.title: My husband absolutely loves this speed gun. He was ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband absolutely loves this speed gun. He was convinced that people were speeding up and down our residential street. Well, we've only clocked one car travelling over the speed limit, much to his dismay, but he still enjoys using it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas H. Firth III

customer_reviews.title: Works very well for me
customer_reviews.text: I have checked it several times and it is very accurate for measuring the speed of the vehicles on the street in front of my house. It works whether a vehicle is going away or coming toward you. It works through the windshield of a vehicle so you can sit in your car and take readings. I have had it about a month and it is very useful. I consider it a good deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: JJB.

customer_reviews.title: Had to get a new toy to play with..
customer_reviews.text: Recently picked up an old X-band police radar gun and got interested in how they worked. I found this one, price was right and it is a different band ( K, I believe ). First thing I did, was disassemble it, sure enough, it has an actual radar horn antenna. Yes, I am aware the warranty is void, but I don't care. The unit still works and now I know what's inside it. Seemed to be of decent quality construction, the molding went back together without much fuss. I've used it to track cars and other objects, not baseballs yet. So far, I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Consider saving for a better unit....
customer_reviews.text: 3 stars because it's "ok" and nothing more. The unit we bought was not consistent... a 75 mph fastball in one reading (which is probably accurate) followed by the same pitch, same location, roughly the same speed... and it registers in the 50's. It might just be this one unit... but I only have this one unit to judge from. At this point I would suggest saving a little more and going up a notch to the $300 level (actually $299)... from what I understand, there aren't many problems with the unit that comes in at that price.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Not Accurate for Baseballs -- Add 5-8 mph to Recorded Speed
customer_reviews.text: The reviews that say this gun clocks baseballs anywhere from 5-8 mph slower than actual velocity are correct. I have a high school player who was clocked with professional equipment at college prospect camps. This gun consistently records him AT LEAST ~5 mph slower, and often much more than that. The Bushnell gun can still be useful to get a general sense of how hard a pitcher throws and whether he's making progress. But you CANNOT use it to determine official velocity for recruiting purposes. It biases way too low for that. If I'm standing about halfway between the mound and the plate, I add 8 mph to recorded speed to get a general idea of a HS pitcher's velocity.
customer_reviews.author: DE area resident

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that I'm VERY pleased with this product. I believe if you follow the directions exactly and make sure you are directly in line with the throw, you will be within 1-2 mph +/-. The readings are pretty consistent and I rarely get errors. Even my 8 year old can use it and he has a great time. I think unless you are a pro scout or have a kid that is college level or higher, you have no reason to spend more money than this product. It should meet the needs of 95% of customers. Definitely a good buy,
customer_reviews.author: Telerush

customer_reviews.title: Melts in your hands
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item a couple of years ago and it worked fine. I had it in a closet and recently took it out to use it and discovered that the entire rubber or plastic surface was essentially dissolving. Cheap materials will do this. At any rate it was sticky to the tough and left a sticky residue on anything it touched so I just had to throw it away.
customer_reviews.author: A. C. Croft

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: This is the most inaccurate piece of garbage. I could not be any more upset with this purchase. Not even close. I have tried everything....I have looked at videos showing how to use to make sure I am using it right..... and nothing I do gets even close to an accurate reading. Used it right next to a friends radar gun and not even close. Best readings I ever got I was still off by 10-30 mph. Why even make this if it doesn't work?
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE- this is a NO RETURN POLICY! This product ...
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE- this is a NO RETURN POLICY! This product has failed multiple forms for tracking a High School pitcher's speed. With two different guns from other parents this speed gun was always off by 7-12 mph. Had the gun for two days and can not return. Should have started with the higher quality -Pocket Radar Ball Coach / Pro-Level Speed Training Tool and Radar Gun-
customer_reviews.author: davit1

customer_reviews.title: Warning ⚠️Buyers
customer_reviews.text: Inaccurate. I purchased this to verify that cars were speeding in our condos. It was 10-30mph off. We tested it several different ways: in a car, bicycle, and motorcycle. Not one time did it give us an accurate reading. THIS IS A NON-RETURNABLE ITEM!! The manufacturer may know it’s quality and thus the reason it is labeled as such. I’ve never had an issue buying an item and if it’s defective returning it. I checked the page again, it’s not listed either. Beware!
customer_reviews.author: Candice Bown

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item and it didn't work well from day one. The speed readings are inaccurate and the controls are very touchy. If you're looking for a radar I would suggest one of the pocket radars. Don't waste your money on this items...
customer_reviews.author: Richard L Blue

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Unit will not even turn on...tried two different sets of brand new batteries nothing. Read the directions several times to make sure that I was not missing anything. Very disappointed. Tried to return and the Amazon link kept directing me back to Busnell’s customer page. Ships from and sold by Amazon should not be as difficult to return.
customer_reviews.author: USA Resident

customer_reviews.title: Good Speed gun if you want to speed test Drones (and even Tiny Whoops!)
customer_reviews.text: Great speed gun for the price - works great to test the speed of my drones! I also tested in on the car at 20mph 25mpp and 30mph and it was accurate to 1mph.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Sugano

customer_reviews.title: Fun for a change at practice or our clinics
customer_reviews.text: The kids on the team and coaches had fun with this. It works well and is a great way to work in some fun at practice or lacrosse clinic.
customer_reviews.author: My3sons

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY IT.  They Won't Return Your Money and it's Not Consistent
customer_reviews.text: I used this at one softball practice, used it as directed, and it gave inconsistent results. It was very frustrating. There was no way I could use this to help our kids measure their improvements. This company sucks. I had to go to their website and print out a return slip. Then I had to pay to return it, and then they sent it back and said the return was denied. Don't waste your money on this piece of junk or this ridiculous company that won't stand behind its products. I'd give this a -5 stars if possible, and I will never buy anything from Bushnell again.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Frizzle

customer_reviews.title: Simple, yet ENDLESS uses!!
customer_reviews.text: Applicable to anything you want to use it for. I just happen to use to to twart potential speeders going through my neighborhood. Feel so easy in your hand, point and shoot like a nerf gun. With the local Law Enforcement acknowledging me using it to radar passing motorists and display their ridiculous speeders passing by on youtube, they told me I'm breaking no laws in what Im doing and actually aid in helping me patrol more. Fun Uses: -Speed Guess Drinking Game (use your own rules) -Set New Self PB run speed -Fastball Pitching -Trains, Cars, boats, jet ski -Drag Races -Race Animals -RC car speed #RadarDad
customer_reviews.author: average.joe

customer_reviews.title: Not Accurate
customer_reviews.text: It clocked cars on the highway in front of my house at 30 mph or less, when the speed limit is 55. Very inaccurate for clocking baseball pitches which is what it was purchased for. Very disappointed in this product. I requested a refund, which was granted by Amazon very promptly.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Beckman

customer_reviews.title: Amazon doesn’t stand behind  Bushnell product .. do the math
customer_reviews.text: The unit that was shipped to me doesn’t work, it won’t power on. Fresh C batteries tested with a meter, inserted properly and zero power. The kicker .. Amazon wants me to deal with Bushnell .no option to return to amazon on App ... why is that ?? Probably because they realize Bushnell just sent out defective items and let the consumers be hassled .. I don’t know what the answer is .. perhaps a local Family owned business who stands behind the products they sell ... I am tired of the assumption that my time is a cheap commodity ..
customer_reviews.author: mavy1373

customer_reviews.title: Seems accurate!
customer_reviews.text: I'm using it to check tennis serve speeds. It can be tricky to get in line with the ball, and not have the person's motion affecting the result, and the aiming needs to be fairly exact, but the speeds seem accurate and repeatable. We ended up sitting on the ground in front of the person serving, facing away, with the gun facing slightly up, and letting the ball fly past overhead
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Item doesn't work as Advertised! only works at short range
customer_reviews.text: Product description says it works up to 1500 feet. It doesn't! It will work on vehicles at 200 but anything greater then that it wont read the speed! I used my golf range finder and on vehicles traveling only 100 yards away, it wont read their speeds!!! Maybe ok for your kids pitches in your backyard but that is it! Amazon will not honor a return after only having it for 3 days. I want my money back. product does not work as advertised! DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!! Now I have a $92 paper weight!!!
customer_reviews.author: William Maloney

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money on this junk.
customer_reviews.text: Product is junk. Stopped working properly with 2nd use. Tried to return the item and they won’t accept the return on a factory level even though it’s been just over a week and it’s not working. Poor product and service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great and don't count on Bushnell for any support
customer_reviews.text: First time using this it gave very bad readings. Put in very good C batteries (not included of course) and it was within 1 mph of a much better, more expensive professional gun. By the way, tried to return it and Amazon sent me to Bushnell. Called Bushnell several times but stayed on hold for 30 minutes each time. Sent emails to Bushnell and no reply at all. Bushnell customer service is horrible.
customer_reviews.author: KeithandShilloy

customer_reviews.title: A solid device with smart industrial design
customer_reviews.text: A solid device with a pleasing texture and design let down by a sticky trigger. Seems to provide accurate results and surprisingly works through windows and blinds. I have yet to confirm its accuracy but I feel as if it’s likely spot on based on life experience. Clever ridge alongside of main body not only rigidifies case but makes it easy to pick up from a hard surface. Make sure you’re aiming directly at object you intend to track.

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE - PERFORMS POOR AND NO RETURNS ACCEPTED
customer_reviews.text: Beware!!!!!! It definitely give slower than actual readings and is inconsistent. Beware!!!!! When it is not performing the way you think it should, THEY DO NOT ACCEPT RETURNS. I'VE BEEN BURNED AND CAN'T RETURN THIS ITEM, I WANTED TO RETURN IT ON DAY ONE.
customer_reviews.author: John Emberger

customer_reviews.title: Useful for Speeding Cars
customer_reviews.text: We have a bus stop on a highly traveled road. I used this to verify the speeds of cars coming by. In the first day, I verified what I expected: AVG speed was 15+ over the limit for all cars on our road. This thing works wonders. Sent in the results to our local PD.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Totally worthless!
customer_reviews.text: We compared this to our training center’s Stalker 2 (I.e. the device used by most MLB teams) and as many people have mentioned, it was about 5mph slower. A radar gun that is not accurate is, in my opinion, totally worthless. After all, the reason you buy such a device is to know, rather than guess, how fast a pitcher is throwing. Unfortunately, this just keeps you guessing. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: JR Williams

customer_reviews.title: Is it accurate?
customer_reviews.text: You can use this device to measure the speed of ... a baseball, car, ...etc. I asked a police officer to compare this device to his courtroom-quality /legal/calibrated/accurate speed gun -- and they agreed. Although the Bushnell device does not have the calibration-verified features that his does, they reported speed with the same numbers. Note: in order for such a device to be accurate, the object (car, etc), has to be moving directly toward you or away from you. If it is moving at an angle, the reading will show less than the actual speed of the (...car), etc.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Sokolove

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT USE FOR BASEBALL
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely no accuracy or reliability. After just a couple of uses it just started flashing numbers when nothing is thrown. Squeeze trigger and it flashes 162 or 81 almost routinely whether nothing is thrown or something of any speed is thrown. Trying to get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: uandme

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate Speed Readings
customer_reviews.text: Used this speed gun for baseball and softball pitchers. The speed numbers on this Bushnell product are completely inaccurate, as confirmed by other "real" radar guns. Sometimes the numbers are too high, other times too low. It's very unreliable and disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!!
customer_reviews.text: This radar gun is garbage! It's no where near accurate with my son pitching and when I tried calling Bushnell all lines were busy all day and I could never get through. Do not buy this gun you will be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Madison Kenzie

customer_reviews.title: Great radar gun. Very accurate.
customer_reviews.text: Great radar gun. Very accurate. Very easy to use. You have to understand it’s limitations... You have to be either directly behind or directly in front of what you are measuring (the pitcher) and you can’t be incredibly far away from what you are measuring (up in the stands) but for the price, this is everything that a recreational coach will ever need.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Not even remotely close to accurate
customer_reviews.text: This is a toy. It's not anywhere near an accurate measuring device. 3 kids on my 14U team throw between 75 and 80 as verified by several showcase events with Baseball Factory, UA, NCTB, etc. Those organizations use Pocket Radar and other higher-end radar devices. This Bushnell garbage has never shown higher than 68. I've stood behind the pitcher, behind the catcher, and everywhere else I can think of trying to get a decent reading, but zero luck. This thing is trash. Save your money and spend a bit more for something that actually works.
customer_reviews.author: erin

customer_reviews.title: Can't use for baseball
customer_reviews.text: We bought this product for my son to use to measure his baseball throwing and hotting velocity. While it is easy to use and measures the speed of cars, motorcycles and bikes, we have not been able to get it to work for a baseball-we get readings from 20 mph to 100 mph both facing the hitter/thrower and from behind, and it doesn't seem to correlate at all. Wish we had spent the extra money for a pocket radar, which we will probably have to anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Lori McDowell

customer_reviews.title: DONT USE FOR BASEBALL/SOFTBALL INCONSISTENT
customer_reviews.text: I’m not the one to usually write reviews but this radar gun has troubled me. I’ve been gunned at showcases and tournaments throwing 70-80 and this gun will not break past 65 no matter the angle. I’ve been gunned for launch velocity 80+ but this gun only says 55 at the most. I wish I had saved for the pocket radar. Do not buy this gun if your seriously interested in verified numbers . Biggest waste of money this year equivalent of throwing money directly down the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: MARIA

customer_reviews.title: It gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: So my 10 year old son SWEARS he pitches 50 MPH. So, I bought this gun to show him different. The first few pitches clocked at 35 mph. He stretched and warned up with a few soft pitches. After a while the gun registered 39 and 40 mph. So, it got the job done. The max speed for his age group is 40 mph. So it is pretty accurate from what I see.
customer_reviews.author: DLo H.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for youth baseball
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 guns this one and top of the line. I use this one while catching my 12 year old son. It’s only 1 mph off from Stalker pro. Which was 1k radar gun. This is perfect for middle school or earlier. I prob wouldn’t use this for high school or if you were not able to get right behind pitcher or catcher
customer_reviews.author: JAMM

customer_reviews.title: Awesome get it
customer_reviews.text: Got it for baseball practice with my boys. Works great, very consistent. Very motivational for kids when they see an actual number and then try to beat it. Kid was 21 when I got the gun... immediately jumped to 28 because he WANTED to throw harder. 8 months later.... he throws 38 now. Also great for batted speed of balls. Gives kids a number to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny R

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product, do not buy, does not work
customer_reviews.text: It never worked. I gave it a try past the 30-day return policy and i regret. Please do not buy this product, trust me. Buy any other radar gun even if it is more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: ANDERSON HERNANDEZ

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware: Amazon Doesn't Accept Defective Bushnell Returns -- You Need to Call the Manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two Bushnell Radar Guns. One worked fine but the other one didn't power up at all. Went to return it but surprise -- Amazon doesn't accept returns and says that I need to contact the manufacturer. I called up Bushnell and the hold operator said that I was the 12th person on hold and I would have to wait for 20 minutes. After 70 minutes on hold, they told me to contact Amazon since that is where I bought it. Stay tuned!
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This speed gun works great! Works great for clocking speeding cars! A+
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can NOT read the instructions
customer_reviews.text: I could NOT read the incredibly small font used for the directions. I even over to a neighbor and asked a16 year old to read them to me. I had to go on the web and find the instructions on Bushnell website. Other than that it is really a very good product....
customer_reviews.author: Raidergrode

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for a science fair project. Has been in ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a science fair project. Has been in constant, daily use for months now. Works as described. Compared it, side by side, with a calibrated police radar gun... readings are within 1-2mph consistently.
customer_reviews.author: Saint Harambe

customer_reviews.title: Surprised
customer_reviews.text: My expectations were some what low because of the price and numerous similar models cost over $200. So far it's worked well and used it as a lacrosse training tool. I brought it to a practice as well and it was a great teaching tool and motivated players to listen to change to increase shot speed
customer_reviews.author: Jooksing Copley

customer_reviews.title: Did not work upon arrival - communication poor at best with Bushnell
customer_reviews.text: Product showed up broken, Amazon directed me to reach out to Bushnell Customer Service. I reached out and did not hear back for 6 weeks. I wish this product worked, instead I am stuck with a paper weight and no one to return it to. Please stay away from this product at all costs and go with something a little higher end.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Sauerwine

customer_reviews.title: Gun is inconsistent in use
customer_reviews.text: This radar is gun is very inconsistent it only works from the back. The reading are inconsistent as well one time you will get no reading. I would not buy this gun and the seller will not return item.
customer_reviews.author: Rogerhm1

customer_reviews.title: Never gives an accurate reading
customer_reviews.text: I have tried every way to get an accurate reading and never do. I have stood both behind my son and in front of him when he pitches. I will sometimes get two readings from one throw or the velocity reading is clearly way off. Same thing with hitting. It never gives an accurate reading of the balls exit velocity. VERY DISAPPOINTED!!!!
customer_reviews.author: FAJA

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed. I don’t think it’s accurate I haven’t gotten to test that yet but I’m pretty sure it isn’t. I wish I would have just saved and bought a better one. We were wanting to use to see how fast my daughter is pitching. The speed never changes.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Cookson

customer_reviews.title: Great for planes
customer_reviews.text: Great radar gun for clocking how fast our RC planes go.
customer_reviews.author: David Shepp

customer_reviews.title: Works for baseball
customer_reviews.text: Bought to track son’s pitches, progress with his velocity training program. Very easy to use, got the hang of it quickly. Numbers are consistent with what we’re seeing at the baseball facility so I think it’s accurate, at least for baseballs.
customer_reviews.author: Seathrun

customer_reviews.title: Barely works
customer_reviews.text: 10% of the time I would get a reading of mid-70s for exit velocity off a tee. Most of the time it said 19 or 20 mph. I tried in line with the ball (behind a net) and behind the batter getting the ball going away.
customer_reviews.author: Scooter

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly well for cars
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. Just point and pull trigger. I got this to verify how fast speeders were going in my neighborhood with kids. I don’t mind people speeding a little bit. But 50 mph in a 25 mph zone?? I always knew it was fine but now at least I know I’m not crazy.
customer_reviews.author: L. Leader

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy this
customer_reviews.text: Should’ve read the reviews before purchasing. We’ve used 3 different sets of new batteries and the speed gun will not turn on! Amazon is not taking this back.
customer_reviews.author: C. Granados

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Being a police officer i can attest to these radar guns. This gun works as well as any i have used, As a Matter of fact i tested it against a Customs XP 10 not the new models, and the readings were identical, Need i say more.
customer_reviews.author: Jacknyd

customer_reviews.title: Best for highway use!
customer_reviews.text: Best feature about this’s is ability to stop speeders. Fun game to play is driving on the highway and someone flies past you and you see they have a radar detector. Fun to “check their speed” and their brakelights at the same time :)
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is great for pitching. I was holding it while I was catching with my son. When I knew he did not throw it as hard or harder the mph adjusted perfect. Also tested it on some cars to verify. This gun is not to be used from far away from a baseball. You Need to be close upon it.
customer_reviews.author: Swampman

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: is it accurate? who knows dosent work. it turns on then you depress the trigger and nothing. cant return it either. garbage. do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Mahony

customer_reviews.title: It's Gun-na be Me
customer_reviews.text: The gun works 50% of the 'thyme' and I'm not certain how accurate it is. I use it to clock my tennis serves, seems somewhat accurate....when it works. Out of 10 serves, it probably misses catching a velocity for 4-5 of them lol. I guess you get what you pay for. For the price it's ok.
customer_reviews.author: Memes

customer_reviews.title: pretty cool
customer_reviews.text: I was curious as to My grand sons (plural) throwing ability. Pretty slow. But to be honest, faster than mine. MLB is probably not in any our futures, unless We watch on TV.
customer_reviews.author: kevin hamilton

customer_reviews.title: A bit disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I thought the readings were way off and very inaccurate when using it for baseball pitching. Easy to use however. A bit disappointing as I was excited to buy a radar gun that was affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT FOR TENNIS PLAYERS
customer_reviews.text: I HELP MY DAUGHTERS SERVE SPEED WITH THIS PRODUCT. MY USING IT SHE PINNED THE BEST TOSS, BEST MOTION TO INCREASE SERVE SPEED. IT ALSO WORKS GREAT AT NIGHT, WHERE COURTS ARE LID... THE PERFORMANCE DOESN'T REALLY CHANGE... GREAT LARGE DISPLAY AND KM/H - MILES/H CHANGE AVAILABLE...
customer_reviews.author: Ali Ozgun

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Bushnell radar gun is so inconsistent in its accuracy! Hard earned money mowing yards for the summertime and it’s about as reliable as a broken down car. No returns thru Amazon and the phone number for Bushnell that we called asked us to leave a message...which we did. It’s been over a week and they never returned our call. Now the window for any type of compensation is closed. What a disappointment from what we thought would be a reputable company.
customer_reviews.author: Sandee Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: The top of the line radar guns, for baseball, cost about $300. This unit runs around $80.00. We tested against the top of the line radar gun, and it correlated extremely well. Important that one shoots directly behind the catcher or the pitcher. Excellent unit. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: R. Wager

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Would not turn on right out of the box. Even bought new batteries thinking maybe that was it, Nope. It would be nice if they tested their products after producing them. Ya. think!!!
customer_reviews.author: Caterham

customer_reviews.title: Old school, cheap, but it works
customer_reviews.text: Works but kind of old school look. The pocket radars look cooler. Also you need to be directly behind the catcher for this to be accurate. It's physics
customer_reviews.author: Mike M

customer_reviews.title: What can I say, it works
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to see how fast clay pigeons are. A different and much more expensive radar clocked them at 41.3mph, this one clocked them at 41mph, as it doesnt give the decimals.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Fun Fun and Fun
customer_reviews.text: We are a racing family and this was so much fun. It it easy to use and light in weight. Everyone at the tracked wanted to know where I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret M

customer_reviews.title: Sorry it didn't work
customer_reviews.text: We followed directions had in batteries the the thing turned on but would not "clock" anything. It was very heavy as well.
customer_reviews.author: Larson Family

customer_reviews.title: very fun
customer_reviews.text: Use it on road trips to see how fast other cars are going. It drives guys with radar detectors nuts. they think the popo is near. Have no clue it is your suv that is setting off their radar detector.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fuentes

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: This unit seems accurate. I don't have anything to compare it to except the average speed of the players I am radaring. I am happy with this unit and would recommend it to any little league coach that is curious to know pitch speeds
customer_reviews.author: christopher pearson

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work and ain’t accurate.
customer_reviews.text: This product does not work. I will be returning it because the speed isn’t accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Wise

customer_reviews.title: We have a lot of fun with this
customer_reviews.text: We have a lot of fun with this! We hosted a baseball party and everyone measured their pitch. Based on what I know of my friends' athletic abilities, it was fairly accurate. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Holly K.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to check out sons pitching speed and to evaluate improvement over time. Well pleased with the accuracy and the simplicity.
customer_reviews.author: John McFarland

customer_reviews.title: Great pitching tool
customer_reviews.text: Great tools for pitchers 12u. You can see how well they are improving from drills throughout the year.
customer_reviews.author: Shawnp31

customer_reviews.title: Not for bat speed, intermittent for pitching
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to help my son with bat speed and mechanics as we shelter in place. Completely useless for this...can't get a consistent reading at all. Waste. For pitching, is intermittent at best. Even aiming toward a pitching machine for my younger son and results jump around so much there isn't much confidence. Beware...this is a non-returnable item through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Andy U.

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: Not hard to figure out and pretty easy to use. Best I can tell it's accuate.
customer_reviews.author: Alaskantimberwolf

customer_reviews.title: Hard to Get Accurate Readings

product_meta.title: Bushnell Velocity Speed Gun
product_meta.description:
Size:standart

Knowing how fast a player pitches or runs can instantly influence a coaching decision. Enter the Bushnell Velocity speed gun, which tells you the speed of an object within plus-or-minus 1 mile per hour. The Bushnell Velocity is outfitted with digital signal processing technology, which can measure the speed of a baseball from up to 90 feet, or a moving vehicle from as far as 1,500 feet. As a result, it's a breeze to take a player's 40 time or measure the speed of a tennis serve. The Velocity is also a breeze to use, with a point-and-shoot pistol grip that displays the fastest speed timed once the trigger is released. The Bushnell Velocity radar gun offers easy point-and-shoot operation that can be used for tracking everything from race cars to pitching speeds. A large LCD display makes it easy to read the speed. Aim the Velocity at the target and depress the trigger. As a quick reference to accuracy, remember to keep your target’s direction of travel in a direct line with you and not perpendicular to you 

Specifications:

 * Baseball/softball/tennis range: 10 to 110 mph (90 feet away) 
 * Auto racing range: 10 to 200 mph (1,500 feet away) 
 * Accuracy: +/- 1 mph 
 * Dimensions: 4.3 by 8.4 by 6 inches (W x H x D) 
 * Weight: 19 ounces 
 * Warranty: 2 years 

Operating Tips:

 * To ensure accurate speed readings, be sure to keep your target's direction of travel in a direct line with the speed gun, and not perpendicular.
 * The Velocity Speed Gun will measure the relative speed of a target as it moves towards or away from the Speed Gun. If the target is in a direct line, the measured speed will be accurate within +/- 1 mph.
 * If you move either right or left of the target, the displayed speed readings will become progressively less accurate, with the indicated speed decreasing as you move off this centerline. This happens due to the "Cosine Effect", common to all Doppler based radar devices.
 * Be sure to use only fresh, alkaline "C" batteries in the Velocity Speed Gun, both inserted positive (tip) end first, with the negative end of each battery facing you (towards the battery cover).
feature_bullets: Large, clear LCD display. Note: Batteries need to be installed appropriately for the item to turn on and function
Displays fastest speed once trigger is released
An easy point and shoot speed gun with +/- 1.0 MPH accuracy
Can track the speed of a ball from 10 feet up to 110 MPH
Measures 4.3 x 8.4 x 6 inches (W x H x D); 2 year warranty

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
